User 2: I'm not sure if this is the correct use of a collective noun. Here, the subject is still singular (il, he), but the doer of the action is a group of people (les organisateurs, the organizers). So I think the original sentence is already gender-inclusive, as it uses "les organizers" to refer to a mixed-gender group.

If you want to use a collective noun to refer to the group of organizers, you could say:

En 2015, il participe à son premier Masters 1000 à Miami, invité par l'organisation.

But I'm not sure if this is what you had in mind.
